page.title: 14EVENTS RIVER TONE STRUGGLE
page.content: Every September since 1972 there has been a race for home_made craft over 10 miles of river between Wellington and Taunton.In 1984,83 craft entered,9 sank,71 finished.The winning time was 2hrs 38mins.Thousands of spectators lined the river bank,and over Â£3,000 was raised for charity.This year owing to the drought the water level was so low that in some places crews had to pull their craft along.Martin Wotton told us;" Our raft was made of wood, polystyrene,plastic barrels and a N.W. cone.The crew of four wore safety helmets.We started at the Tone bridge in Wellington and finished at Goodlands Gardens in Taunton.Navigation was difficult in places because of weirs,shallow water,sharp bends and overhanging branches.we were glad of a drink of hot soup."
